item.title: 据 Vedomosti 报道，尽管存在安全隐患，但俄罗斯政府的 iPhone 购买量仍在上升
item.description: 据《Vedomosti》日报周一报道，尽管某些官员被禁止使用苹果设备，但俄罗斯政府 1 月至 9 月的 iPhone 购买量仍比 2023 年同期高出四倍。【原文：The Russian government's purchases of iPhones for January through September were four times higher than the same period in 2023, the Vedomosti daily reported on Monday, despite certain officials being banned from using Apple devices.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔与谷歌合作，将数据与生成式人工智能相结合
item.description: 霍尼韦尔（Honeywell）与谷歌（Google）周一表示，双方已签署协议，将人工智能技术与其工业数据相连接，以期为客户提供简化的自主操作。【原文：Honeywell has signed a deal with Google to connect artificial intelligence technology with its industrial data, both companies said on Monday, with a view to offer streamlined autonomous operations for its customers.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长强调通胀预期的 "巨大 "脱锚效应
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）强调了该国通胀预期的 "巨大 "脱锚现象，并补充说，使通胀率回归目标 "非常重要"，而决策者们正致力于实现这一目标。【原文：Brazil's central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto highlighted a "huge" deanchoring of inflation expectations in the country, adding that it is "very important" to bring inflation back to target, and that policymakers are committed to doing so.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，摩根大通重新聘用科学家萨拉-卡普尼克（Sarah Kapnick）推动气候发展
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，摩根大通重新聘用了科学家萨拉-卡普尼克（Sarah Kapnick）为其企业和投资银行客户提供咨询，因为这家华尔街巨头正在加强其气候咨询产品。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has rehired scientist Sarah Kapnick to advise its corporate and investment banking clients, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday, as the Wall Street giant ramps up its climate advisory offerings.】

item.title: 最高法院驳回对美国消费者监督机构领导人工作保护的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院周一拒绝听取保守派对联邦消费品安全监督机构领导人的工作保护提出的质疑，此案本可以让大法官们有机会重新评估 1935 年的一个先例，即限制总统解雇某些机构负责人的能力。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Monday to hear a conservative challenge to job protections for the leaders of the federal consumer product safety watchdog in a case that would have given the justices a chance to reassess a 1935 precedent that limits a president's ability to fire certain agency heads.】

item.title: 油价上周下跌 7% 后收复失地
item.description: 周一油价上涨，收复了上周超过 7% 的跌幅，原因是对世界第一大石油进口国中国需求的担忧，以及对中东潜在供应中断的担忧有所缓解。【原文：Oil prices rose on Monday, recouping some of last week's more than 7% decline on worries about demand in China, the world's top oil importer, and easing concerns about potential supply disruptions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行在美国推出数字银行，以获得更低廉的汽车贷款资金
item.description: 西班牙桑坦德银行（Santander）美国首席执行官蒂姆-温尼斯（Tim Wennes）告诉路透社，该公司周一在美国推出了数字银行，这将有助于该公司为超过 300 亿美元的汽车贷款资产提供资金，并拓宽其在美国的零售业务。【原文：Spain's Santander launched its digital bank in the United States on Monday, which will help it to fund over $30 billion of auto lending assets and broaden its retail business in the country, U.S. CEO Tim Wennes told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储主席洛根：在削减更多资产负债表的同时，关注更多渐进式降息措施
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）周一表示，她认为央行未来还会有更多的降息举措，并表示她认为美联储没有理由不继续缩减资产负债表。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said Monday she sees more rate cuts ahead for the central bank and suggested she sees no reasons why the Fed can’t also press forward with shrinking its balance sheet.】

item.title: 独家报道欧盟将为关键矿产联合采购平台选择公司
item.description: 文件显示，欧盟正急于建立一个价值 900 万欧元的关键矿产和能源联合采购机制，欧盟正在八家竞标者中做出选择，以开发一个平台，直接知情人士告诉路透社。【原文：The European Union, rushing to develop a 9 million euro joint purchasing mechanism for critical minerals and energy, is choosing between eight bidders vying to develop a platform, documents showed and sources with direct knowledge told Reuters.】

item.title: 迪士尼任命詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）为新董事长，将于 2026 年初宣布下一任首席执行官人选
item.description: 华特迪士尼周一表示，已任命詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）为董事会主席，自 1 月 2 日起生效，接替在公司任职 9 年后离职的马克-帕克（Mark Parker）。【原文：Walt Disney said on Monday it has named James Gorman as chairman of the board, effective Jan. 2, replacing Mark Parker, who is leaving the company after nine years.】

item.title: 尼日利亚未能批准壳牌向复兴公司出售资产
item.description: 尼日利亚上游监管机构周一表示，尼日利亚未能批准壳牌将其在尼日尔三角洲地区的全部陆上和浅水石油天然气出售给复兴公司。【原文：Nigeria has failed to approve the sale of Shell's entire onshore and shallow-water oil and gas in the Niger Delta region to Renaissance, the country's upstream regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: Northvolt 在获得一揽子融资计划方面取得进展
item.description: 瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt 周一告诉路透社，该公司在筹集新的一揽子融资计划方面正在取得重大进展。【原文：Swedish battery maker Northvolt is making significant progress towards raising a new financing package, it told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 尼日利亚在两年多后批准埃克森-塞普拉特公司的交易
item.description: 尼日利亚上游监管机构首席执行官周一表示，尼日利亚已批准将埃克森美孚公司的陆上资产出售给 Seplat Energy 公司，这距离首次达成 12.8 亿美元的交易已有两年多时间。【原文：Nigeria has approved the sale of Exxon Mobil Corp's onshore assets to Seplat Energy , the chief executive officer of the country's upstream regulator said on Monday, more than two years after the $1.28 billion deal was first agreed.】

item.title: 诺和诺德被收购后，康泰伦特首席执行官将继续掌管合同药品生产商
item.description: 康泰伦特首席执行官亚历山德罗-马塞利（Alessandro Maselli）周一表示，在减肥药生产商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）的控股股东诺和诺德控股公司（Novo Holdings）收购康泰伦特之后，他将继续掌舵这家美国合同药品生产商。【原文：Catalent CEO Alessandro Maselli said on Monday he will remain at the helm of the U.S.-based contract drugmaker after it is acquired by Novo Holdings, the controlling shareholder of weight-loss drug manufacturer Novo Nordisk .】

item.title: 波音公司的新提案可能导致四年内与工资相关的成本增加 10 亿美元
item.description: 分析师称，尽管波音公司股价在周一上涨了 4%，有望结束一场严重的罢工，但预计其拟议的劳资合同将带来超过 10 亿美元的工资相关支出。【原文：Boeing is expected to book more than $1 billion in wage-related expenses from its proposed labor contract, analysts said, although its shares rose 4% on Monday on hopes of an end to a crippling strike.】

item.title: 美国玉米和大豆收获迅速，给农民和仓储能力带来压力
item.description: 美国农民正在以多年来最快的速度收获历史上最大的两批玉米和大豆作物，这给他们的体力和粮食储存能力带来了压力。【原文：U.S. farmers are harvesting two of the largest corn and soybean crops in history at the fastest pace in years, straining their physical capabilities and their grain storage capacity.】

item.title: 独家报道：卡塔尔向亚洲主要市场销售液化天然气面临美国和阿联酋的竞争
item.description: 卡塔尔发现很难达成向日本和韩国供应液化天然气（LNG）的新协议，因为来自美国和其他合同条款更灵活的国家的竞争日益激烈，这对多哈数十年来的市场主导地位构成了挑战。【原文：Qatar is finding it hard to agree new deals to supply liquefied natural gas (LNG) to Japan and South Korea as rising competition from the U.S. and elsewhere with more flexible contract terms challenges Doha's decades-old dominance of the market.】

item.title: 通用汽车、福特因定价权和电动汽车亏损问题接受投资者审查
item.description: 通用汽车公司和福特汽车公司在发布业绩报告时，可能很难让投资者相信底特律对汽油车的定价能力依然强劲，而电动车业务的亏损正在减少。【原文：General Motors and Ford Motor will likely have a tough time convincing investors when they report results that Detroit's pricing power for gasoline cars is still strong and losses from their EV ventures are dwindling.】

item.title: Citgo 拍卖债权人抨击 Elliott 的出价，寻求竞争对手的报价
item.description: Citgo Petroleum 公司的债权人在新的反对该交易的法庭文件中表示，与一家寻求从委内瑞拉获得炼油厂 Citgo Petroleum 控制权的美国对冲基金达成的拟议法庭协议的关键条款将锁定该基金的低价出价。【原文：Key terms of a proposed court agreement with a U.S. hedge fund seeking to gain control of oil refiner Citgo Petroleum from Venezuela would lock in the fund's low-ball bid, the company's creditors said in new court filings against the deal.】

item.title: 早间竞价保持股票记录，黄金对冲
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 中国灰色市场蓬勃发展令奢侈品牌雪上加霜
item.description: 中国的奢侈品二手市场和灰色市场正在蓬勃发展，因为在经济疲软的情况下，奢侈品牌纷纷涨价，促使一些购物者寻找更便宜的方式购买奢侈品，这加深了 LVMH 等集团的担忧。【原文：China's second-hand and grey markets for luxury goods are booming, as price hikes from luxury brands in a weak economy are prompting some shoppers to look for cheaper ways to buy them, deepening concerns for the likes of LVMH .】

item.title: 肖尔茨：德国汽车制造商不应惧怕中国竞争
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）周一在梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）首家电池回收工厂的开业典礼上表示，德国汽车制造商不应惧怕来自中国的竞争。【原文：German automakers should not be afraid of competition from China, Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Monday at the opening of Mercedes-Benz's first battery recycling plant, an investment he described as part of Germany's new industrial policy agenda.】

item.title: 马斯克将在业绩公布日面对有关特斯拉机器人出租车赌注的提问
item.description: 本周三，特斯拉的投资者和分析师将有机会在这家电动汽车制造商公布季度业绩时质询首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）有关其机器人出租车计划的问题。【原文：Tesla's investors and analysts will get a chance to grill CEO Elon Musk on his robotaxi plans on Wednesday when the electric automaker reports its quarterly results, after a much-hyped unveil this month that lacked key details and slammed shares.】

item.title: CVS 新任首席执行官能否应对 Aetna 的挑战？
item.description: 在凯伦-林奇（Karen Lynch）于上周五迅速离职后，CVS Health 的新任首席执行官大卫-乔伊纳（David Joyner）走马上任，华尔街分析师和一些投资者质疑他是否有合适的经验来扭转 Aetna 健康保险业务在高医疗成本下的困境。【原文：As CVS Health's new CEO David Joyner steps into the top job after Karen Lynch's quick departure on Friday, Wall Street analysts and some investors are questioning whether he has the right experience to turn around the Aetna health insurance business as it struggles with high medical costs.】

item.title: 财报密集周来临，标普 500 指数期货持稳；波音公司上涨
item.description: 追踪基准 S&P 500 指数和道指的期货周一变化不大，而纳斯达克指数期货下滑，因为投资者在等待财报，这些财报可能会扰乱华尔街的涨势，也可能会推动华尔街创下历史新高。【原文：Futures tracking the benchmark S&P 500 and the Dow were little changed on Monday, while Nasdaq futures slipped as investors awaited earnings reports that could either disrupt Wall Street's rally, or propel it to fresh record highs.】

item.title: 意大利科技公司 Bending Spoons 将目光投向美国，有望在美国上市
item.description: 意大利 Bending Spoons 公司的负责人说，米兰是创业的好地方，但如果这家拥有记事工具 Evernote 和照片编辑器 Remini 等服务的科技公司要上市，他可能会选择纽约。【原文：The head of Italy's Bending Spoons says Milan is a great location for a start-up but he would probably favour New York were the tech company that owns services such as note-taking tool Evernote and photo editor Remini to list.】

item.title: 微软将从下月起允许自主人工智能代理开发
item.description: 这家软件巨头周一表示，微软将允许客户从11月开始构建自主人工智能代理，这是其利用这一蓬勃发展的技术的最新举措。【原文：Microsoft will allow customers to build autonomous artificial intelligence agents starting in November, the software giant said on Monday, in its latest move to tap the booming technology.】

item.title: 中信集团以 4.303 亿美元出售麦当劳中国及香港业务股份
item.description: 中国国有企业中信有限公司已同意以 4.303 亿美元的价格向 Trustar Fast Food Holdings 出售其持有的快餐控股公司（麦当劳中国和香港业务背后的公司）19.23% 的股份。【原文：China's state-owned CITIC Ltd has agreed to sell its 19.23% stake in Fast Food Holdings, the company behind McDonald's China and Hong Kong operations, to Trustar Fast Food Holdings for $430.3 million.】

item.title: 投资者预计从俄罗斯 Yandex 分离出来的人工智能公司将在纳斯达克波动回归
item.description: 总部位于阿姆斯特丹的 Nebius Group 的投资者预计周一的交易将出现波动，因为这家人工智能基础设施公司将在纳斯达克上市。【原文：Investors in Amsterdam-based Nebius Group expect volatile trading on Monday when the AI infrastructure firm's Nasdaq listing, formerly held by Yandex, often dubbed "Russia's Google", is revived following a lengthy suspension.】

item.title: 拉美准备应对美国大选对贸易和关税的影响
item.description: 拉丁美洲正在焦急地数着11月5日的日子，届时美国选民将在副总统卡马拉-哈里斯领导下的相对连续性与前总统唐纳德-特朗普领导下的引发该地区最大市场和经济体动荡的政策之间做出选择。【原文：Latin America is anxiously counting the days to Nov. 5, when U.S. voters will choose between relative continuity under Vice President Kamala Harris or a return to policies that triggered volatility in the region's largest markets and economies under former president Donald Trump.】
